cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference remains 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: The storm today is ranked 8th for the amount of rainfall recorded during one storm.  13.04mm fell at a maximum rate of 8.6mm per hour over 7.9 hours.  27.64mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 15.9 hour precipitation event.  At times precipitation was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today ranked highest for the heaviest rainfall, with a peak intensity of 27.0mm per hour sustained for 2.0 hours, resulting in a total accumulation of 7.99mm.

storm.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 23 November 2024, it lasted 23.2 hours, delivered 24.56mm of rain at a maximum rate of 6.4mm per hour.
Weather alert: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 5th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on 26 August 2025 and has lasted 9 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (199°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 73.5 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.7°C) and outside temperature (up 2.9°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 1.7 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1551 m), light levels (up 3594 lux), and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 41.0m higher than yesterday, 438.7m lower than the past week, 1550.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 713m and a peak of 1594m, averaging 1107.9m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; temperatures should feel nicely warm. Also, very clammy and humid and little or no wind. Some rain can be expected, occasional overcast conditions, and periods of sunshine are expected. Changeable conditions.
